content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Add a Date Input Element to a FlexCard

Add a Date Input element on a FlexCard to enable users to select a formatted date from a calendar widget. From the Properties panel, configure properties and custom attributes.

Configure properties common to all Input elements:

* Field Binding: bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
* Field Label: enter the label that appears next to the element.
* Placeholder: enter temporary text that displays inside the input field.
* Required: check if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.
* Read-only: disable the ability to modify the input values.
* Help Text: enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field.

Add custom attributes:

* Click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section.
* Select an attribute from the dropdown.
* Enter a value for the attribute.

Configure additional properties available to the element:

* Minimum Date and Maximum Date: set the date range.
* Date Format: update the format, default is MM-dd-yyyy.
* Default Value: select a default input value or enter a plain text value in the specified format.

To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action. To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.
title: Adding a Date Input Element to a FlexCard
